id: controlled party in an affiliation situation
name: controlled party in an affiliation situation

id: CorporateControl.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the issue resolutions identified in the FIBO BE 1.0 FTF report.
name: CorporateControl.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the issue resolutions identified in the FIBO BE 1.0 FTF report.

id: CorporateControl.rdf version of this ontology was revised to further clean up definitions related to control via ownership of shares, which only applies to corporations and some partnerships, and revise and extend the definition of affiliation.
name: CorporateControl.rdf version of this ontology was revised to further clean up definitions related to control via ownership of shares, which only applies to corporations and some partnerships, and revise and extend the definition of affiliation.

id: CorporateControl.rdf version of this ontology was modified as a part of a simplification strategy for the organizational class hierarchy and to correct reasoning anomalies.
name: CorporateControl.rdf version of this ontology was modified as a part of a simplification strategy for the organizational class hierarchy and to correct reasoning anomalies.

id: party that is related to a legal entity, directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, and controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with that entity, typically determined by the degree of ownership
name: party that is related to a legal entity, directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, and controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with that entity, typically determined by the degree of ownership

id: A subsidiary is a separate, distinct legal entity from its parent company(ies) for the purposes of taxation, regulatory compliance, and with respect to liability.
name: A subsidiary is a separate, distinct legal entity from its parent company(ies) for the purposes of taxation, regulatory compliance, and with respect to liability.

id: party that is recognized as the ultimate parent of a given organization within the country or jurisdiction of incorporation or organization
name: party that is recognized as the ultimate parent of a given organization within the country or jurisdiction of incorporation or organization

id: CorporateControl.rdf version of this ontology was revised to allow any legal entity to participate in control relations rather than limiting control to a stock corporation, and simplifying others such that any party can be a significant shareholder, for example, rather than limiting this role to a legal entity.
name: CorporateControl.rdf version of this ontology was revised to allow any legal entity to participate in control relations rather than limiting control to a stock corporation, and simplifying others such that any party can be a significant shareholder, for example, rather than limiting this role to a legal entity.

id: voting shareholder that owns 100 percent of the voting shares in some legal entity
name: voting shareholder that owns 100 percent of the voting shares in some legal entity

id: legal entity that is entirely or majority owned and controlled by another legal entity
name: legal entity that is entirely or majority owned and controlled by another legal entity

id: CorporateControl.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the FIBO 2.0 RFC to add missing definitions and labels, eliminate references to BusinessFacingTypes, replace min 1 QCRs with someValuesFrom, address other hygiene issues, and limit the burden of certain restrictions, such as those on stock corporation, for typical applications.
name: CorporateControl.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the FIBO 2.0 RFC to add missing definitions and labels, eliminate references to BusinessFacingTypes, replace min 1 QCRs with someValuesFrom, address other hygiene issues, and limit the burden of certain restrictions, such as those on stock corporation, for typical applications.

id: In the case of companies that are subsidiaries of another company that itself has a parent, this identifies the organization at the top of the hierarchy, world-wide. Adapted from consensus definition of Ultimate Parent, now that this is split into national and global parent.
name: In the case of companies that are subsidiaries of another company that itself has a parent, this identifies the organization at the top of the hierarchy, world-wide. Adapted from consensus definition of Ultimate Parent, now that this is split into national and global parent.

id: relates a legal entity to a party that has 100 percent ownership and control over it
name: relates a legal entity to a party that has 100 percent ownership and control over it

id: relates an organization to another recognized as its ultimate parent, within its country or jurisdiction of incorporation, if it has one
name: relates an organization to another recognized as its ultimate parent, within its country or jurisdiction of incorporation, if it has one

id: consensus definition of ultimate parent, with the split between domestic and global parent
name: consensus definition of ultimate parent, with the split between domestic and global parent

id: indicates a controlled affiliate that it owns at least 50 percent of
name: indicates a controlled affiliate that it owns at least 50 percent of

id: controlling party in an affiliation situation
name: controlling party in an affiliation situation

id: This ontology defines concepts relating to corporation-specific control. These concepts are based on the general types of control (both de facto control and controlling interests), as defined in the ControlParties ontology, and are the specific examples of these concepts as they apply to companies incorporated by the issuance of shares.
name: This ontology defines concepts relating to corporation-specific control. These concepts are based on the general types of control (both de facto control and controlling interests), as defined in the ControlParties ontology, and are the specific examples of these concepts as they apply to companies incorporated by the issuance of shares.

id: relates a legal entity to another organization that it owns at least 50 percent of
name: relates a legal entity to another organization that it owns at least 50 percent of

id: CorporateControl.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).
name: CorporateControl.rdf version of the ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: shareholder whose shares confer the right to vote in corporate elections, including the right to elect directors at annual or special meetings, and to express their views to corporate management and directors on significant issues that may affect the value of those shares
name: shareholder whose shares confer the right to vote in corporate elections, including the right to elect directors at annual or special meetings, and to express their views to corporate management and directors on significant issues that may affect the value of those shares

id: Note that the concept of significance varies depending on the jurisdiction, and particularly with respect to reporting requirements. For example, in some cases, three (3) percent ownership of any class or series of shares is considered significant, and in others it means more than five or ten percent of the total combined voting power across all classes of securities.
name: Note that the concept of significance varies depending on the jurisdiction, and particularly with respect to reporting requirements. For example, in some cases, three (3) percent ownership of any class or series of shares is considered significant, and in others it means more than five or ten percent of the total combined voting power across all classes of securities.

id: CorporateControl.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: CorporateControl.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: In the case of companies that are subsidiaries of another company that itself has a parent, this identifies the organization at the top of the hierarchy of organizations in the country of registration. Adapted from consensus definition of Ultimate Parent, now that this is split into national and global parent.
name: In the case of companies that are subsidiaries of another company that itself has a parent, this identifies the organization at the top of the hierarchy of organizations in the country of registration. Adapted from consensus definition of Ultimate Parent, now that this is split into national and global parent.

id: relates an organization to another recognized as its ultimate parent, if it has one
name: relates an organization to another recognized as its ultimate parent, if it has one

id: By virtue of holding 100 percent of the share ownership, the total controlling interest company also holds 100 percent of the controlling equity, if there is a difference. Therefore, it is both a total owner and a total controlling party.
name: By virtue of holding 100 percent of the share ownership, the total controlling interest company also holds 100 percent of the controlling equity, if there is a difference. Therefore, it is both a total owner and a total controlling party.

id: party that is recognized as the ultimate parent of a given organization world-wide
name: party that is recognized as the ultimate parent of a given organization world-wide

id: situation in which a controlled party is affiliated with a controlling party for some period of time
name: situation in which a controlled party is affiliated with a controlling party for some period of time

id: CorporateControl.rdf version of the ontology was modified to incorporate the latest insights into how control relations should integrate with the control situation.
name: CorporateControl.rdf version of the ontology was modified to incorporate the latest insights into how control relations should integrate with the control situation.

id: CorporateControl.rdf version of the ontology was modified to simplify control concepts and relations.
name: CorporateControl.rdf version of the ontology was modified to simplify control concepts and relations.

id: has a party which directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with the company
name: has a party which directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control with the company

id: party that shares capital, technology, human resources, risks, and benefits of an entity under shared control
name: party that shares capital, technology, human resources, risks, and benefits of an entity under shared control

id: controls directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries
name: controls directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries

id: relates a party which directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control by another party to that party
name: relates a party which directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, controls, or is controlled by, or is under common control by another party to that party

id: is controlled directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries and owned at least 50 percent by
name: is controlled directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries and owned at least 50 percent by
